block.p: Julianne Ferencz, the daughter of Maxine Ferencz and Dr. Jonathan Ferencz of Chappaqua, N.Y., was married yesterday in Wilmington, Vt., to Kevin Babione, the son of Carolyn and Richard Babione of Reston, Va. Rabbi Albert L. Sturmer officiated at the White House of Wilmington, an inn.
Mr. and Mrs. Babione are consultants for CK Consulting in Lititz, Pa., a service founded by the bridegroom that helps businesses implement computer software.

Julianne Ferencz, the daughter of Maxine Ferencz and Dr. Jonathan Ferencz of Chappaqua, N.Y., was married yesterday in Wilmington, Vt., to Kevin Babione, the son of Carolyn and Richard Babione of Reston, Va. Rabbi Albert L. Sturmer officiated at the White House of Wilmington, an inn.
Mr. and Mrs. Babione are consultants for CK Consulting in Lititz, Pa., a service founded by the bridegroom that helps businesses implement computer software.

The bride, 29, graduated from Dickinson College and received a master's degree in international management from the American Graduate School of International Management. Her father is a prosthodontist in New York and a clinical professor of prosthodontics at New York University. Her mother, who is retired, was the director of the Northern Westchester Parent Child Group, an education center in Bedford, N.Y.

The bridegroom, 36, graduated from Pennsylvania State University and is a candidate for an M.B.A. degree at Villanova University. His parents, now retired, owned Five Star Realty, a residential real estate company in Reston.
